channel.title: Introduction on Practical Process Automation - Book Website
channel.description: Recent content in Introduction on Practical Process Automation - Book Website

item.title: Customer Onboarding Example
item.description: Customer Onboarding Example # Alongside Chapter 2, there is this example that shows the customer onboarding process of a fictional telecommunications company as executable process solution. Link To GitHub # Customer Onboarding Process on GitHub Stack # It used the following stack: Camunda Cloud Java Spring Boot The process model contains three tasks: A service task that executes Java Code to score customers A user task so that humans can approve customer orders (or not) A service task that executes glue code to call the REST API of a CRM system The process solution is a Maven project and contains:

item.title: Order Fulfillment Example
item.description: Order Fulfillment Microservices Example # In Chapter 7 and 8, there is this example that shows various microservices interacting to fulfill a customer’s order. You can understand that there does not need to be any central orchestration and every microservice might include some process logic. Furthermore, you can also compare the solution approach to a pure event-based choreography. Link To GitHub # Order Fulfillment on GitHub Stack # It used the following stack:

item.title: BPMN
item.description: BPMN # About # Business process model and notation (BPMN) is an ISO standard, so there are many good resources available to learn more about it. You find some recommendations on this page. If you miss anything or know of any valuable resource that is not listed, don’t hesitate to give feedback or open a pull request for this page (click on the edit this page button at the bottom of the page).

item.title: Other Examples
item.description: Other Examples Mentioned in the Book # Beside the two bigger use cases of Customer Onboarding and Order Fulfillment there are a couple of smaller examples promised in the book. You can find respective links to runnable source example on this page. Combining Process Models and Programming Code # As mentioned in Chapter 3 (“Combining Process Models and Programming Code”), there are three conceptual ways to link BPMN process models with glue code.
